intro: Labichea, commonly known as the coffee plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The most well-known species, Labichea arabica, is prized for its beans used in coffee production. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white or pink.
